original: DAHLGREN, Fredrik Axel, Byråingeiijör, Docent, Djursholm, f Skara 26/6 93 av lekt Sven D o Augusta Frölich, gm Mary Falck. Fil kand Upps 15, KTH 20, tekn dr 29. Anst The Fuller Electr & Manufact Co, London, 20—22, stat provn.anst o patentv 23—24, Sthlms el.v 24, byråing sed. 28, doc i teor elektrotekn KTH sed. 30, ordf i Sv elektroingfrn, gen.-sekr i sv centr.komm f intern ing.kongr, styr.led i sv elektr kommiss. Av trycket: A general electromagn theory of electr machines (grad.avh 29), ett 50-t upps i elektrotekn ämn. LIVA.
translated: DAHLGREN, Fredrik Axel, Civil Engineer, Associate Professor, Djursholm, born in Skara on June 26, 1893, to teacher Sven D and Augusta Frölich, married Mary Falck. Bachelor of Arts from Uppsala in 1915, Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in 1920, PhD in engineering in 1929. Employed at The Fuller Electric & Manufacturing Co, London, from 1920 to 1922, as a state examiner and patent evaluator from 1923 to 1924, Stockholm Electric Company from 1924, civil engineer since 1928, appointed associate professor of theoretical electrical engineering at KTH in 1930. Chairman of the Swedish Association of Electrical Engineers, general secretary of the Swedish Central Committee for International Engineering Congress, member of the board of Swedish Electrical Commissioners. Published: A general electromagn theory of electrical machines (thesis, 1929), over 50 papers on electrical engineering topics. Still alive.

memberOf.name: Swedish Central Committee for International Engineering Congress
